title: Mohammad Hafeez highly criticizes PCB’s new domestic structure
text:
Pakistan cricket team’s experienced all-rounder Mohammad Hafeez speaks out against the new domestic structure of Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) which left many players and officials unemployed.

Hafeez took notice of a post on Twitter showing a cricketer, Fazal Subhan, who is driving a Suzuki Loader in Karachi to earn bread and butter for his family after losing his job due to the closure of departmental cricket.

The 38-years-old cricketer felt for the cricketer and replied to the post to attract more people towards it. He wrote: “So sad Really, Like him & Many others are suffering. The new system will look after 200 players but 1000s of cricketers & management staff are unemployed because of this new model, I don’t know who will take the responsibility of this unemployment of cricket fraternity, for all the victims”

So sad Really , Like him & Many others r suffering, New system wil look after 200 players but 1000s of crickters & management staff r Unemployed bcos of this new model , I dont know who wil take the responsibility of this unemployment of cricket fraternity, 🤲🏼 for all the victims https://t.co/SaQfAKVFU2 — Mohammad Hafeez (@MHafeez22) October 12, 2019

It is pertinent to mention here that PCB enforced a new domestic structure consists of just six regions in the country.

The new system brought plenty of problems for players and officials as departments fired all of them which in result affected their families.
